Class Person

java.lang.Object
Person
Record Components:
userid - Is a private String that holds the Person objects personal identification number.
firstname - Is a private String that holds the Person objects firstname.
lastname - Is a private String that holds the Person objects lastname.
phonenumber - Is a private String that holds the Person objects phonenumber.
address - Is a private String that holds the Person objects address.
email - Is a private String that holds the Person objects email address.
class Person extends Object
Class Person has private Strings which hold the information a Person object has. It also holds methods constructing a new Person object as well as methods that aquire certain aspects of the specific Person object depending on what the end user wants to currently do.
Author:
Juho Yli-Rajala

  • Constructor Details

    • Person

      public Person(String uid, String fname, String lname, String phonenum, String add, String emai)
      This method is the constructor for a new Person object. A new Person object must have an id, firstname, lastname, phonenumber, address and an email. The Person is constructed using the set methods.
      Parameters:
      uid - User id is a mandatory String that the Person must have and it is validated using class Verify. The String is then placed as the Person objects information using the Persons setId() method.
      fname - Users firstname is a mandatory String that the Person must have and it is validated using class Verify. The String is then placed as the Person objects information using the Persons setFname() method.
      lname - Users lastname is a mandatory String that the Person must have and it is validated using class Verify. The String is then placed as the Person objects information using the Persons setLname() method.
      phonenum - Users phonenumber is a mandatory String that the Person must have and it is validated using class Verify. The String is then placed as the Person objects information using the Persons setPhone() method.
      add - Users address is a mandatory String that the Person must have but can be set as " " and it is validated using class Verify. The String is then placed as the Person objects information using the Persons setAddress() method.
      emai - Users email address is a mandatory String that the Person must have but can be set as " " and it is validated using class Verify. The String is then placed as the Person objects information using the Persons setEmail() method.

  • Method Details

    • showPerson

      public void showPerson()
      This method is used to show all of the Person objects information through JOptionPanel MessageDialog.

    • updatePerson

      public Person updatePerson(ArrayList contacts)
      This method is used to update a Person objects information. The method first checks if the end user has given a new String to be stored into the old informations place. The method then proceeds to verify the new String using the correct verifying method. If the end user doesn't enter a new String it uses the old information using the Person objects get() methods.
      Parameters:
      contacts - This is the contacts list where the id refers to when defining if the end users given input for id was already presented in another Person objects data.
      id - This is the new id that is asked from the end user. If the end user decides to press enter the String is then filled with the original userid using the Persons getId() method.
      fname - This is the new id that is asked from the end user. If the end user decides to press enter the String is then filled with the original firstname using the Persons getFname() method.
      lname - This is the new id that is asked from the end user. If the end user decides to press enter the String is then filled with the original lastname using the Persons getLname() method.
      phoneno - This is the new id that is asked from the end user. If the end user decides to press enter the String is then filled with the original phonenumber using the Persons getPhone() method.
      address - This is the new id that is asked from the end user. If the end user decides to press enter the String is then filled with the original address using the Persons getAddress() method.
      email - This is the new id that is asked from the end user. If the end user decides to press enter the String is then filled with the original email using the Persons getEmail() method.
      updated - This is a new Person object that is constructed using the Persons constructor method. The Person is constructed using the new/old information.
      Returns:
      This method returns the newly generated Person object updated.

    • validateDel

      public int validateDel()
      This method is used to ask if the end user wants to proceed deleting a Person object. The method first shows the Person objects information and asks the end user to press either yes or no to delete the Person object that is currently being shown.
      Parameters:
      yesno - This integer holds the end users input which is then validated.
      Returns:
      Returns the integer value that yesno holds currently.

    • validateUpd

      public int validateUpd()
      This method is used to ask if the end user wants to proceed updating a Person object. The method first shows the Person objects information and asks the end user to press either yes or no to update the Person object that is currently being shown.
      Parameters:
      yesno - This integer holds the end users input which is then validated.
      Returns:
      Returns the integer value that yesno holds currently.

    • setId

      public void setId(String id)
      This is the set method for a Person object that sets a String for the private userid a Person object owns.
      Parameters:
      id - This is the String that is being set for the Person object.

    • getId

      public String getId()
      This is the get method for a Person object that gets the private String userid a Person object owns.
      Returns:
      Returns the private String userid of the Person object.

    • setFname

      public void setFname(String first)
      This is the set method for a Person object that sets a String for the private firstname a Person object owns. The method also automatically raises the first letter of the String to an uppercase character.
      Parameters:
      first - This is the String that is being set for the Person object.
      formalf - This is the String first but the first character is now in uppercase.

    • getFname

      public String getFname()
      This is the get method for a Person object that gets the private String firstname a Person object owns.
      Returns:
      Returns the private String firstname of the Person object.

    • setLname

      public void setLname(String last)
      This is the set method for a Person object that sets a String for the private lastname a Person object owns. The method also automatically raises the first letter of the String to an uppercase character.
      Parameters:
      last - This is the String that is being set for the Person object.
      formall - This is the String last but the first character is now in uppercase.

    • getLname

      public String getLname()
      This is the get method for a Person object that gets the private String lastname a Person object owns.
      Returns:
      Returns the private String lastname of the Person object.
